title: Series: Analysis, diff. eq., and Lagrange part - b

content.question: Show that <math> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>!</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> approximates f(1) with error less than <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>100</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>.

frqParts.text: Show that <math> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>!</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> approximates f(1) with error less than <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>100</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
